meanings.definition: The plural form of acropolis, meaning a citadel or fortified hill of an ancient Greek city.
meanings.sent1: The acropolises in Greece were important strongholds in ancient times.
meanings.sent2: Tourists often visit the acropolises in Athens to learn about ancient Greek history.
meanings.sent3: The acropolises decided to have a race to see which one was the fastest!
meanings.sent4: The acropolises stood tall like guardians watching over the city below.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the acropolises painted a beautiful silhouette against the sky.

meanings.definition: The plural form of acropolis, meaning a high point in a city or town.
meanings.sent1: From the acropolises, you could see the entire city spread out below.
meanings.sent2: The acropolises provided a stunning view of the surrounding landscape.
meanings.sent3: The acropolises were the perfect spot for a picnic with a view.
meanings.sent4: The acropolises loomed over the city like silent sentinels.
meanings.sent5: The lights of the city twinkled below the acropolises like stars on the ground.
